result.title: MCP Development Guide
result.description: Learn how to build MCP servers and clients
result.text:
Building MCP Servers
This guide walks you through creating your first MCP server.
By the end, you'll understand the core concepts and be ready to build
production-ready integrations.
Prerequisites
Before starting, make sure you have:
Python 3.10+ or Node.js 18+ installed
Basic understanding of JSON Schema [1]
Familiarity with async programming (see our async primer [2] )
Installation
Install the MCP SDK using your preferred package manager:
pip install mcp-sdk
For TypeScript users, see the npm package [3] .
Your First Server
Create a new file and add the following code. This creates a simple
server that exposes a calculator tool:
from mcp import Server, Tool
server = Server("calculator")
@server.tool()
async def add(a: int, b: int) -> int:
"""Add two numbers together."""
return a + b
if __name__ == "__main__":
server.run()
Testing Your Server
Use the MCP Inspector [4] to test your server
interactively. For automated testing, see testing best practices [5] .
Next Steps
Now that you have a basic server running:
Learn about resources [6] for exposing data
Add prompts [7] for guided interactions
Explore example servers [8] on GitHub
